remarks: Two ways of saying that the composition of two relations is included in a third relation.  See its special instance ~ cotr2 for the main application.  (Contributed by RP, 22-Mar-2020.)
statement:
cotr2g.d $e |- dom B C_ D $.
cotr2g.e $e |- ( ran B i^i dom A ) C_ E $.
cotr2g.f $e |- ran A C_ F $.
cotr2g $p |- ( ( A o. B ) C_ C <-> A. x e. D A. y e. E A. z e. F ( ( x B y /\ y A z ) -> x C z ) ) $.
$d A x y z $.
$d B x y z $.
$d C x y z $.
$d D x y z $.
$d E y z $.
$d F z $.
